title: Apple iPad Mini 4: lighter, thinner, faster iPad Mini
text:
News from: Eza Ezamie Page views: 47 times September 9th 2015 was the day Apple created history by unveiling their latest models, namely iPad Pro and iPad Mini 4. It was greeted with a lot of optimism and perhaps it is about time for fans to upgrade their device. - Advertisement - 
Let’s take a closer look at what the iPad Mini 4 brings to the table, especially being lighter, thinner and faster. Does it stop just there, or is there anything else to look forward to? 
First up would be the measurement of the iPad Mini 4 which comes in at 203.2 x 134.8 x 6.1 mm (8.0 x 5.31 x 0.24 in) and weighing at 299 gram for the Wi-Fi model and 304 gram for the 3G/LTE model. It sure into is incredibly sleek and has a portable design that you can easily carry with you. In fact, it truly is slim and lightweight which says a lot about it. The durable aluminum unibody offers seamless beauty that will be able to last you for years. 
The iPad Mini 4 will be sporting a similar 7.9-inch LED-backlit IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen with 1536 x 2048 pixels or ~324 ppi pixel density that is the same as its predecessor. As means for protection, it comes with a scratch-resistant glass and oleophobic coating to protect your precious investment. The gorgeous Retina display is incredibly immersive and will suck you in whether you are watching, shopping, playing or working. 
It will come with Apple’s latest A8 chipset paired with a Dual-core 1.5 GHz processor and 2GB RAM that is said to improve CPU performance by 5.2 times and graphics performance by up to 12.8 times faster. Prepare also to meet with Metal is Apple’s latest technology that that lets developers design highly immersive console-style games. Metal is optimized to allow the CPU and GPU to work together to deliver detailed graphics and complex visual effects. - Advertisement - 
As far as the camera is concerned, the iPad Mini 4 comes with an 8 Megapixel primary camera with a 1.2 Megapixel secondary camera. It has an improved sensor, advanced optics, and a state-of-the-art image signal processor. The iSight camera in lets you capture incredibly detailed photos and cinematic 1080p HD videos. The FaceTime HD camera has also been redesigned with a new sensor that makes your video calls look better, even in low light conditions. And the high-resolution Retina display makes for a spectacular viewfinder. 
iPad mini 4 is as easy to use as a point-and-shoot camera, but it is much more advanced. Go ahead to fire off 10 photos per second in burst mode. It will automatically detect smiles and blinks and grabs the best shot. You can also shoot at 120 fps to create slow motion videos. Or use Time-lapse mode to compress into a few amazing seconds events that take anywhere from 30 minutes to 30 hours. 
Once you have captured a photo or video, there is a lot more that you can do. And it makes editing very easy due to its built-in editing apps that work seamlessly with all your images. Adjust exposure, color, brightness, and contrast. Add filters. Edit a movie with iMovie. Or use third-party apps to get even more creative. 
The iPad Mini 4 comes with the latest iOS 9 which is the world’s most advanced, intuitive and secure mobile operating system. If it feels like it was custom made for iPad, that’s because it was. From the elegant interface to powerful multitasking features and useful built ‑ in apps, iOS 9 is designed to help you get the most out of your iPad. 
Battery-wise, it provides up to 10 hours of battery life. It can handle work, play, and everything in between. Thanks to advancements in iOS 9, iPad Mini 4 can make that power last even longer. 
In terms of storage, you have the option to go for 16 GB, 64GB or 128GB. There will be no microSD slot available, as you would expect from any of Apple’s devices. - Advertisement - 
You know that the Apple iPad Mini 4 improves in terms of performance and its look and feel. Plus by having the latest iOS 9 right out of the box, complements it a lot and serves as the right software for all its prowess. 
Expected to be released very soon, the Apple iPad Mini 4 will be available for $399 for 16GB Wi-Fi, $499 for 64GB Wi-Fi, $599 for 128GB Wi-Fi, $529 for 16GB Wi-Fi + Cellular, $629 for 64GB Wi-Fi + Cellular and $729 for the most expensive 128GB Wi-Fi + Cellular variant. You can choose from Silver, Gold or Space Gray. News From
